title: (x) Fonts on House M.D. title sequence - Century Gothic, various similar {Stephen, Skylar, Richard Hards}
content:
I’ve been wanting to know this for some time now, but haven’t the time to post the screenshots. I am trying to identify both the San Serif of the credits as well as the Serif on the medical diagrams in the background.

At first i thought the San Serif was Futura, but realised it was quite diffrent. Maybe its a variation?

Thanks!

 [‹ (x) "Objectiv" logo by Superfamous - Alba {Lex}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202143440/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29678 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Sisusta 24 geometric sans logo - ITC Bauhaus {Lari} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202143440/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29675 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Erakez

comments.content: Sans - Maybe [Nobel](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202143440/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FB.116809.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=ROBERT+LEONARD&sampleSize=32). Really need a larger sample. Could be Futura after all.
Never mind. The J and S are wrong on Nobel.

Ahh, I knew there were some odd shapes in there. [Century Gothic.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202143440/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.10372.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=HUGH+LAURIE&sampleSize=48)

[Century Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202143440/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/century-gothic/)

Skylar

Edit: Oops! A bit too late...

The narrow S looks more like Century Gothic

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202143440im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Century%20%20Gothic_5527.gif)
  
than Futura
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202143440im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Futura_4361.gif)
  
to me.

EDIT: :-)

The serif may be hand written (the numerals are at least), but here are some in that style:

[Excelsior](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202143440/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.120853.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=dorsal&sampleSize=48)  
 [ITC Century](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202143440/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=ITC.119123.0.4&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=dorsal&sampleSize=48)  
 [News 706](http://web.archive.org/)

ahhh century gothic. i knew it looked familiar!

Thanks all!
